title: Cognitive Load Management Strategies for Bach Fugue Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A music theory-integrated course for science sector managers aimed at expanding creative thinking.

learning_goals: Learners can apply analytical techniques for independent voice differentiation when performing a four-part fugue.
Learners can achieve over 80% accuracy in identifying themes/subjects and counterthemes by combining visual notation and aural training.
Learners can practice complex rhythm patterns at three distinct speeds using a section-based segmented practice strategy.
Learners can achieve over 20% improvement in accuracy when practicing tempo maintenance using digital tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
